intro: Corunastylis conferta, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in open habitats such as dunes and cliffs. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Corunastylis conferta is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
